oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 3Î²-HSD Activity and Gestagen Concentrations of Bovine Fetal and Maternal Placentae During Pregnancy and on Parturition
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tsumagari, S.
Takagi, K.
Tanemura, K.
Yosai, A.
Takeishi, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: progesterone
placentae
P syntheses
gestagen levels
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: As bovine uterine arterio-venous progesterone (P) levels indicate no differences, P is reportedly not produced in placenta.1,2 However, many documents3-7 have demonstrated and confirmed the P synthesis in tissue cultures of placentae. In contrast to attenuated bovine corpus luteal functions in the later half of gestation,4,8 the P level in blood indicates a substantial increase until near term.9,10 Such an increase in P level at late period of gestation has been attributed to derive from the placenta10,11 and the adrenal. Our present study therefore attempted to investigate P syntheses in both fetal and maternal placentae by measuring the synthesis-related enzyme, 3
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1992: Volume 3; 72-77
